What happens is when we teleport ships using the rendezvous setup, they will slide on their orbit. With 2 ships it is annoying. With 3 there is a explosion, and rarely a immortal space debree that breaks space and time that I nick named P.E.T.E (I just came up with this btw: Potentially Extremely dangerous Terrestrial Ex-object). Any it seems all our ships when put into orbit slide along it and due to using rendezvous to get them up there collide instead of stopping at a distance. Since we have none of our ships ready to go fly to orbit and we don't have the time to do so or do it in the first place we are in a bad spot. Anyway when I sit down to do additional testing I will try to give you a exact distance. Sadly I am busy with scholarships at the moment and time is something I am lacking.....

I assume you're speaking to me - if not, please says so.

I'm sorry but that picture doesn't tell me anything.

What makes a ship "infected" in this context?

I'll need all relevant details - not just where it's happening, but every step you're taking (what you're clicking/typing/etc.) to make it happen.

When testing around Laythe, I've had zero explosions.

However, I do see what may be a bug or limitation with HyperEdit's Rendezvous function. When there are more than 2 craft in formation, it seems that HyperEdit may be getting confused as to which craft to link up with, and orbital velocities are getting boogered. I can see how that might cause ships to collide, thus creating the fireworks.

If this matches with what you're seeing, lemme know. I will be checking with The Creator to see what can be done.
